sen.j: 鏑矢（かぶらや：希に蕪矢とも書く）は矢の先端、鏃の根元に位置する形で鏑（後述）を取り付けられた矢の名称。
sen.e: 鏑矢 (Kaburaya: in rare cases, written as 蕪矢) is the name of an arrow with kabura (to be described later) installed at the end of zoku; the top of an arrow head.
sen.cmt: 文意を明確にするために全角漢字を残しています。
sen.e: 鏑矢 (Kaburaya: in rare cases, written as 蕪矢) is the name of an arrow with kabura (to be described later) installed at the end of zoku; the top of an arrow head.
鏑矢 (Kaburaya: in rare cases, written as 蕪矢) is the name of an arrow with kabura (to be described later) installed at the end of zoku; the top of an arrow head.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には既に記述が見られる（保元物語）が、初期の頃は名称も定まっておらず起源、いつ頃から使われていたのかは解っていない。
sen.e: Kaburaya was already described (Hogen Monogatari; the Tale of the Hogen War) in Kamakura period, and the name of Kaburaya was not fixed early on; it is unknown about its origin and when it started to be used.
Kaburaya was already described (Hogen Monogatari; the Tale of the Hogen War) in Kamakura period, and the name of Kaburaya was not fixed early on; its origin and when it began to be used is unknown.
Kaburaya was already described (Hogen Monogatari; the Tale of the Hogen War) in Kamakura period, and the name of Kaburaya was not fixed early on; its origin and when it began to be used is unknown.

sen.j: 種類
sen.e: Type
Type
Type

sen.j: 鏑（かぶら）とは矢の先端に付ける武具の一種。
sen.e: Kabura is a kind of arms that was installed at the top of an arrow.
Kabura is a kind of weapon that was installed at the tip of an arrow.
Kabura is a kind of weapon that was installed at the tip of an arrow.

sen.j: 大きさは全長で5cm前後から20cm前後まで大小様々で、円筒形、円錐形、或は紡錘形を基本とし、詳細な形状は一様ではない。
sen.e: It varied in size from small to large; around 5 - 20 cm, and also varied in its detailed shape; its basic shape was cylindrical shape, conical shape, or fusiform shape.
It varied in size from small to large; around 5 - 20 cm, and also varied in its detailed shape; its basic shape was cylindrical shape, conical shape, or fusiform shape.
It varied in size from small to large; around 5 - 20 cm, and also varied in its detailed shape; its basic shape was cylindrical shape, conical shape, or fusiform shape.

sen.j: 矢への取り付けは基部から先端まで矢箆を貫通させ、先端から鏃を挿して固定する。
sen.e: To install Kaburaya to an arrow, pull kaburaya from the base through to the top, and fix it by putting zoku (an arrowhead) from the top.
To fix Kaburaya to an arrow, pull the kaburaya from the base through to the top, and fix it by putting zoku (an arrowhead) on the tip.
To fix Kabura to an arrow, pull the yano from the base through to the top, and fix it by putting zoku (an arrowhead) on the tip.

sen.j: 中身が刳り貫かれており中空構造になっており、通常は割れが生じないよう数カ所糸で巻き締め固定し、仕上げに漆で塗り固めてある。
sen.e: It is hollow; it is usually wrapped up by threads at a few points, fixed, and finished with lacquer so that it won't be cracked.
It is hollow; and usually wrapped with thread at a few points, fixed, and finished with lacquer so that it won't crack.
It is hollow; and usually wrapped with thread at a few points, fixed, and finished with lacquer so that it won't crack.

sen.j: 材質は朴や桐など軽量で加工性の良い木材、かつては鹿角や竹根も用いられた。
sen.e: It is made of readily-processable light lumber such as ho, paulownia; deer horn or bamboo root were once used.
It is made of easy to process light wood such as ho, paulownia; even deer horn or bamboo roots were once used.
It is made of easy-to-process light wood such as ho, paulownia; even deer horn or bamboo roots were once used.

sen.j: 蟇目
sen.e: 蟇目 Hikime
sen.cmt: 文意を明確にするために全角漢字を残しています。
sen.e: 蟇目 Hikime
蟇目 Hikime

sen.j: （ひきめ：引目とも書く）とは上記鏑に数カ所の穴を開けたもので、鏑と同様に矢箆を上下に貫通させ、釘上のもので固定する。
sen.e: (Hikime: also written as 引目) was Kabura, which was mentioned above, with a few holes, and it was fixed by nails after pulling yano from the top through to the bottom in the same way as Kabura.
(Hikime: also written as 引目) was Kabura mentioned above with a few holes, and it was fixed by nails after pulling yano from the top through to the bottom in the same way as for Kabura.
(Hikime: also written as 引目) was Kabura mentioned above with a few holes, and it was fixed by nails after pulling yano from the top through to the bottom in the same way as for Kabura.

sen.j: 正式な造りは4つ穴で、これを四目（しめ）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Formal Hikime was with four holes, and it was called `shime' (four eyes).
Formal Hikime had four holes, and it was called `shime' (four eyes).
Formal Hikime had four holes, and it was called `shime' (four eyes).

sen.j: これを矢の先端に取り付けた矢を放つと穴に空気が流入する事で笛のように音が鳴り、鋭い音を発する。
sen.e: Releasing an arrow with Hikime installed at its top lets air flow into the holes, thus producing an acute sound like a flute.
Releasing an arrow with Hikime mounted on the tip lets air flow into the holes, producing an acute sound like a flute.
Releasing an arrow with Hikime mounted on the tip lets air flow into the holes, producing an acute sound like a flute.

sen.j: 蟇目の出す音が邪を払い場を清めるとされている。
sen.e: It is believed that the sound produced by Hikime removes and purifies the negative vibes.
It is believed that the sound produced by Hikime removes and purifies negative vibes.
It is believed that the sound produced by Hikime removes and purifies negative vibes.

sen.j: 蟇目鏑とも言う。
sen.e: It was also called Hikime Kabura.
It was also called Hikime Kabura.
It was also called Hikime Kabura.

sen.j: 神頭
sen.e: 神頭 Jinto
sen.cmt: 文意を明確にするために全角漢字を残しています。
sen.e: 神頭 Jinto
神頭 Jinto

sen.j: （じんとう：矢頭とも書く）は厳密には鏑とは別物だが、外見が鏑と似ている為、しばしば鏑と混同されがちである。
sen.e: (Jinto: also written as 矢頭) was strictly different from Kabura, however, since they are somewhat similar in their appearances, Jinto was often confused with Kabura.
sen.cmt: 文意を明確にするために全角漢字を残しています。
sen.e: (Jinto: also written as 矢頭) was different from Kabura, however, since they are somewhat similar in their appearance, Jinto was often confused with Kabura.
(Jinto: also written as 矢頭) was different from Kabura, however, since they are somewhat similar in their appearance, Jinto was often confused with Kabura.

sen.j: 古くから存在し、鏑に良く似ているが、中身が刳り貫かれておらず、また大きさも鏑より小さい。
sen.e: It has existed from ancient times, it is quite similar to Kabura, but it is not hollow, and is smaller than Kabura.
It has existed from ancient times, it is quite similar to Kabura, but it is not hollow, and is smaller than Kabura.
It has existed from ancient times, it is quite similar to Kabura, but it is not hollow, and is smaller than Kabura.

sen.j: 紡錘形から円錐形まで形状・大きさとも一様ではなく、材質は軽量、硬質な木材など、古くは海藻の根を乾燥させたものが使用された。
sen.e: It varied in size and in shape; from fusiform shape to conical shape; it is made of light or hard lumber, and dried seaweed roots were used in ancient times.
It varied in size and in shape; from a fusiform to conical shapes; it is made of light or hard lumber, and dried seaweed roots were used in ancient times.
It varied in size and in shape; from a fusiform to conical shapes; it is made of light or hard lumber, and dried seaweed roots were used in ancient times.

sen.j: 鏃の代わりに矢に取り付け、射中てるものを傷を付けないよう、若しくは射砕く目的で使用される。
sen.e: It is installed to an arrow instead of Zoku, and it was used to protect a target from having a scratch, or to crush a target.
It is fixed to the tip of an arrow instead of Zoku, and it was used to protect a target from having a scratch, or in otherwords, used to crush a target.
It is fixed to the tip of an arrow instead of Zoku, and it was used to protect a target from having a scratch, or in other words, used to crush a target.

sen.j: 用途
sen.e: Usage
Usage
Usage

sen.j: 鏑矢
sen.e: Kaburaya
Kaburaya
Kaburaya

sen.j: （かぶらや）とは鏑を矢の先端に取り付け、鏃を有するものを言う。
sen.e: (Kabutraya) refers to an arrow with Kabura installed at its top, and it also has Zoku.
(Kabutraya) refers to an arrow with Kabura fixed at its tip, and it also has Zoku.
(Kaburaya) refers to an arrow with Kabura fixed at its tip, and it also has Zoku.

sen.j: 鏑は小寸のものを用い、鏃には雁又、平根などを挿すのが一般的である。
sen.e: It is common that a small Kabura is used for it and it has Zoku put with gammata, hirane, etc.
It is common that small Kabura are used for and Zoku is mounted with gammata, hirane, etc.
It is common that small Kabura are used for and Zoku is mounted with gammata, hirane, etc.

sen.j: 中世は鏑矢を一手（ひとて）を普通の矢と共に箙に盛り上差矢（うわざしや）とするのが作法であった。
sen.e: In the Medieval Period, putting an arrow of Kaburaya combined with regular arrows in ebira (quiver of arrow) as uwazashiya was a manner.
In the Medieval Period, including an arrow with Kaburaya combined slong with regular arrows in the ebira (quiver) as uwazashiya was was typical.
In the Medieval Period, including an arrow with Kaburaya combined along with regular arrows in the ebira (quiver) as uwazashiya was typical.

sen.j: 現在では流鏑馬など故実の祭礼式などで使用され、また飾り矢として邪を払う縁起の良いものとして親しまれている。
sen.e: Nowadays, it is used in rituals that succeeds ancient customs such as yabusame (horseback archery), and also it is regarded as something lucky, and is well known as Kazariya (decorative arrow) which removes negative vibes.

Nowadays, it is used in rituals that succeed ancient customs such as yabusame (archery on horseback), and it is also regarded as lucky, and is well known as Kazariya (decorative arrow) that removes negative vibes.

Nowadays, it is used in rituals that succeed ancient customs such as yabusame (archery on horseback), and it is also regarded as lucky, and is well known as Kazariya (decorative arrow) that removes negative vibes.

sen.j: 蟇目矢
sen.e: Hikimeya
Hikimeya
Hikimeya

sen.j: （ひきめや）とは蟇目を取り付けた矢の事。
sen.e: (hikimeya) is an arrow installed with Hikime.
(hikimeya) is an arrow fixed with Hikime.
(hikimeya) is an arrow fixed with Hikime.

sen.j: 鏃を付けず、蟇目の出す音で邪を払い場を清める事を目的とし、祭礼神事で使われる。
sen.e: It is intended to remove negative vibes and purify a place by the sound of Hikime without using Zoku, and it is used in rites and festivals and Shinto rituals.
It is intended to remove negative vibes and to purify a place by the sound of Hikime without using Zoku, and it is used in rites and festivals and in Shinto rituals.
It is intended to remove negative vibes and to purify a place by the sound of Hikime without using Zoku, and it is used in rites and festivals and in Shinto rituals.

sen.j: 古くは誕生蟇目・産屋の引目・射越の引目などと称し、胎児の健康、成長祈願や家屋の屋根を越えるように蟇目矢を放ち邪を払い魔を退散させるなどした。
sen.e: In ancient times, Hikimeya was discharged at turning points of a life; on a baby's birthday for praying for the baby's growth; on entering into a birth room for praying for an unborn baby's health; Hikimeya was discharged over the roof of a house when moving into the house in order to remove negative vibes and to drive off evils;
sen.cmt: 射越→引越と考え訳出しました。
sen.e: In ancient times, Hikimeya were shot at turning points of a life; on a baby's birthday for praying for the baby's growth; on entering into a birth room for praying for an unborn baby's health; Hikimeya was shot over the roof of a house when moving into the house in order to remove negative vibes and to drive off evil spirits;

In ancient times, Hikimeya were shot at turning points of a life; on a baby's birthday for praying for the baby's growth; on entering into a birth room for praying for an unborn baby's health; Hikimeya was shot over the roof of a house when moving into the house in order to remove negative vibes and to drive off evil spirits;

sen.j: 現在では小笠原流に『蟇目の儀』が伝わっており、下賀茂神社や住吉大社、一部弓道大会の開会などで行われている。
sen.e: "Hikime-no-Gi" (Hikime ceremony) in Ogasawara school has been carried on until now, it takes place in Shimogamo-jinja Shrine, Sumiyoshitaisha Shrine, and in the opening ceremony of Ichibu kyudo taikai (Japanese archery tournament).

"Hikime-no-Gi" (Hikime ceremony) in the Ogasawara school has been conducted until the present day, it takes place in Shimogamo-jinja Shrine, Sumiyoshitaisha Shrine, and in the opening ceremony of Ichibu kyudo taikai (Japanese archery tournament).

"Hikime-no-Gi" (Hikime ceremony) in the Ogasawara school has been conducted until the present day, and it takes place in Shimogamo-jinja Shrine, Sumiyoshitaisha Shrine, and in the opening ceremony of Ichibu kyudo taikai (Japanese archery tournament).

sen.j: 最近では国際弓道連盟設立記念大会で執り行われた。
sen.e: It has recently been performed in Kokusai kyudo renmei kinen taikai (Memorial tournament for establishment of International Kyudo Federation).
It has recently been performed in Kokusai kyudo renmei kinen taikai (Memorial tournament for establishment of International Kyudo Federation).
It has recently been performed in Kokusai kyudo renmei kinen taikai (Memorial tournament for establishment of International Kyudo Federation).

sen.j: 蟇目鏑矢
sen.e: Hikimekaburaya
Hikimekaburaya
Hikimekaburaya

sen.j: （ひきめかぶらや）とは蟇目矢に雁又、平根などの鏃を挿した形のもの。
sen.e: (Hikimekaburaya) is Hikimeya with Zoku put with gammata, hirane, etc.
(Hikimekaburaya) is Hikimeya with Zoku together with gammata, hirane, etc.
(Hikimekaburaya) is Hikimeya with Zoku together with gammata, hirane, etc.

sen.j: 中世は上差矢として通常の矢と共に箙に盛って携行し、合戦の始めや味方への合図を出す際にこれを放ち、音を出して遠くに伝えた。
sen.e: In the Medieval Period, it was carried with regular arrows in ebira (quiver of arrow) as uwazashiya, and it was discharged to inform someone far by its sound as a signal for the same side or for the starting of a battle.

In the Medieval Period, it was carried with regular arrows in ebira (quiver) as uwazashiya, and it was shot to inform someone far by its sound as a signal for the same side or for the starting a battle.

In the Medieval Period, it was carried with regular arrows in ebira (quiver) as uwazashiya, and it was shot to inform someone far by its sound as a signal for the same side or for the starting a battle.

sen.j: 現在では邪を払う縁起の良いものとされ、飾り矢として親しまれている。
sen.e: Nowadays, it is regarded as something lucky, and is well known as Kazariya (decorative arrow)
Nowadays, it is regarded as bringing luck, and is well known as Kazariya (decorative arrow)
Nowadays, it is regarded as bringing luck, and is well known as Kazariya (decorative arrow)

sen.j: 神頭矢
sen.e: Jintoya
Jintoya
Jintoya

sen.j: （じんとうや）とは神頭を矢の先端に取り付けたもの。
sen.e: (Jintoya) is an arrow with Jinto installed at its top.
(Jintoya) is an arrow with Jinto installed at its tip.
(Jintoya) is an arrow with Jinto installed at its tip.

sen.j: 厳密には鏑矢とは別物である。
sen.e: Strictly, it is different from Kaburaya.
Strictly speaking, it is different from Kaburaya.
Strictly speaking, it is different from Kaburaya.

sen.j: 鏃は挿さない。
sen.e: Zoku was not put.
Zoku was not included.
Zoku was not included.

sen.j: 古くから笠懸、流鏑馬、犬追物など稽古用に使用され、初期の頃は的矢としても用いられた。
sen.e: It has been used for practices for kasagake (horseback archery competition), yabusame (horseback archery), inuoumono (dog-hunting event, a skill of an archery) since ancient times, and it was used as a target arrow.

It has been used in practice for kasagake (horseback archery competition), yabusame (archery on horseback), inuoumono (dog-hunting event, skill of archery) since ancient times, and it was used as a target arrow.

It has been used in practice for kasagake (horseback archery competition), yabusame (archery on horseback), inuoumono (dog-hunting event, skill of archery) since ancient times, and it was used as a target arrow in early times.

sen.j: 現在は武田流、小笠原流に伝わる流鏑馬など、故実の祭礼式などで使用されている。
sen.e: Now it is used in rituals that succeed ancient customs such as yabusame (horseback archery) that has been succeeded to Takeda school or Ogasawara school.
Now it is used in rituals that succeed ancient customs such as yabusame (archery on horseback) that has succeeded to the Takeda or Ogasawara schoos.
Now it is used in rituals that succeed ancient customs such as yabusame (archery on horseback) that has succeeded to the Takeda or Ogasawara schools.
